name: Kangra
description: Kangra is one of the most picturesque districts in Himachal Pradesh, known for its ancient temples, tea gardens, and the famous Kangra Fort. The district offers a perfect blend of history, spirituality, and natural beauty.
summary: Land of Ancient Temples and Tea Gardens

locations.name: Kangra Fort
locations.description: Kangra Fort is one of the oldest and largest forts in the Himalayas, dating back to the 4th century BC. It offers panoramic views of the surrounding valleys and mountains.
locations.address: Kangra Fort Road, Kangra, Himachal Pradesh

travelTips.bestTime: October to March for pleasant weather
travelTips.transportation: Regular buses and taxis from Dharamshala
travelTips.accommodation: Multiple options available in Kangra town

locations.name: Masroor Rock Cut Temple
locations.description: Masroor Rock Cut Temple is a unique monolithic rock-cut temple complex dating back to the 8th century. It's known for its intricate carvings and architectural beauty.

travelTips.bestTime: October to March for comfortable weather
travelTips.transportation: Regular buses and taxis from Kangra

locations.name: Palampur
locations.description: Palampur is a beautiful hill station known for its tea gardens and scenic views of the Dhauladhar range. It's a perfect destination for nature lovers and adventure enthusiasts.
locations.hours: Best time to visit: March to June

locations.name: Baijnath Temple
locations.description: Baijnath Temple is an ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its architectural beauty and spiritual significance. The temple is surrounded by the Dhauladhar range.

locations.name: Andretta
locations.description: Andretta is an artists' village known for its pottery and theater. It was home to famous artists like Norah Richards and Sobha Singh.
